question_title: Will the community prediction be higher than 47.00% on 2026-02-15 for the Metaculus question "Will the DOJ officially remove the requirement for U.S. attorneys to consult with the Public Integrity Section before prosecuting lawmakers before November 4, 2026?"?
summary: This meta-prediction hinges on whether the CP for the DOJ Public Integrity Section question will drift above 47% in the next 10 days. The current CP is exactly at threshold. The news environment favors upward drift: the section has been gutted, related provisions suspended, and DOJ is actively revising policy. However, with 114 forecasters and no immediate catalyst expected, the CP has moderate stability. Since any upward move resolves YES and the policy momentum clearly trends toward eventual removal, I estimate 55% probability that CP exceeds 47% by Feb 15.

factors.description: News environment favors removal - DOJ actively revising policy, section gutted from 36 to 2 lawyers, related provision already suspended
CP exactly at threshold (47%) - any upward drift resolves YES, asymmetric payoff
114 forecasters provides moderate CP stability - not highly volatile, resists random movement
No immediate catalyst expected in next 10 days - unlikely to see major policy announcement before Feb 15
Congressional consultation requirement still technically active - forecasters may note removal hasn't happened yet
